thread.title: Michael Keane can be like Paul Pogba at Manchester United, says Rio Ferdinand
thread.title_full: Michael Keane can be like Paul Pogba at Manchester United, says Rio Ferdinand

title: Michael Keane can be like Paul Pogba at Manchester United, says Rio Ferdinand
text:
Back to the Future Michael Keane can be like Paul Pogba at Manchester United, says Rio Ferdinand 
Burnley star left Old Trafford after coming up through the academy but has been tipped to rejoin and thrive By Sam Morgan Comments MICHAEL KEANE can do a Paul Pogba at Manchester United, insists Rio Ferdinand. 
The ex-Old Trafford defender says the current Burnley centre-half can do the same as the world’s most expensive player and thrive at the club he left for good in 2015. Reuters Rio Ferdinand believes Michael Keane can do a Paul Pogba and go back to Man United 
Keane, like Pogba, was not given much game time after coming up through the club’s academy. 
But now he is hotly tipped to be on the brink of a return to the Theatre of Dreams after impressing for Sean Dyche. 
And Ferdinand believes he can slot in nicely at his old side, much like Frenchman Pogba did when he returned from Juventus in the summer. 
He said: “I think the moment he found out he (Keane) was going to leave Manchester United – every kid’s dream in that area is to play for Manchester United – so to leave the club was a huge wrench for him. Getty Images Rio Ferdinand believes it would make sense for Michael Keane to go back to United Reuters 3 Paul Pogba rejoined his former club for a world-record fee 
“But it allowed him to go and spread his wings and bloom really and become the player he is now. 
“At Manchester United he wasn’t afforded that opportunity, for whatever reason. 
“You look at the likes of Pogba… he’s gone away and come back now and become a huge star. Michael Keane, he could do that himself.” 
Keane said he believed he would always be a United player – but that Sir Alex Ferguson’s departure changed everything. He told the Guardian : "I always felt I would be a Manchester United player. 
"The coaches used to say to me that sometimes they would send other players out on loan to help them get a move but that was never the case with me. 
"They saw it as experience for me because they thought I was good enough to get in the first team when I came back. 
"But then obviously Sir Alex left and it all changed."
